translated: With a serene mind I worshipped🔽at the feet of the Teacher.
I held up a flower of the seven-leaved kepaka tree

analyzed: sugata anugatam magga  pūjetvā haṭṭha mānasaḥ
translated: With a delighted mind I worshipped🔽the path followed by the One with Good Destinies.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
there were three with the crest of fire.
… and the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Gatasaññaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā gatasaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Gatasaññakattherassāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā gatasaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽gatasaññaka therassa apadānam dutiya
translated: The Story of the Elder Gatasaññaka is the second.
